alert.note: Alert for Western Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 31 at 2:09PM AKST until January 04 at 3:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Winds will gust as high as 55 mph. Blowing snow will reduce visibility to near zero at times. * WHERE...Western Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 PM AKST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are expected. Large drifts could form. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 45 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
